title: Tarski's theorem about choice
summary: In mathematics, Tarski's theorem, proved by Alfred Tarski (1924), states that in ZF the theorem "For every infinite set A {\displaystyle A} , there is a bijective map between the sets A {\displaystyle A} and A × A {\displaystyle A\times A} " implies the axiom of choice. The opposite direction was already known, thus the theorem and axiom of choice are equivalent.
